questions.question: What are the advantages of cloud computing over computing on-premises?
What is the pricing model that enables AWS customers to pay for resources on an as-needed basis?
Which of these is not a cloud deployment?
True or False? AWS owns and maintains the network‑connected hardware required for application services, while you provision and use what you need.
Which of these is not a benefit of cloud computing over on‑premises computing?
options: Pay for racking, stacking, and powering services

questions.question: Which of the following are not benefits of AWS Cloud computing?
Which of the following is a compute service?

True or False? Cloud computing provides a simple way to access servers, storage, databases, and a broad set of application services over the internet. You own the hardware required and AWS provisions what you need.
Economies of Scale result from _______.
options: Having a few large enterprise customers
Having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in the cloud

questions.question: For services like Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS, what options are available for Reserved Instances?
Where can a customer get detailed Amazon EC2 billing activity from 3 months ago?
True or False? To receive the discounted rate for Reserved Instances, you must make a full, upfront payment for the term.
There is no charge for which of the following?
options: Data transfer between services within the same AWS Region

questions.question: What are the four AWS Support plans?
Which AWS tool compares the cost of running on‑premises to AWS?
As AWS grows, lower pricing passed to customers due to reduced cost of business is called:
True or False? Some AWS services are offered at no charge, but you might be charged for services used with them.
When are free data transfers applicable across AWS?
options: Inbound data transfer to Amazon EC2
Outbound data transfer between services in the same Region

questions.question: True or False? Unlimited services are available with the AWS Free Tier to new customers for 12 months.
Which AWS Global Infrastructure component does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low‑latency delivery?
Running applications from a Region closer to users will ______ latency.
True or False? Networking, storage, compute and databases are AWS service categories.
Which statement about Availability Zones is NOT true?
options: Made up of one or more data centers
A data center can be used for more than one Availability Zone

questions.question: What is true about Regions? (Choose two)
options: They are the physical locations of your customers
All Regions are in one geographic area
A Region is a physical location with multiple Availability Zones
Each Region is in a separate geographic area

questions.question: Which are geographic areas that host two or more Availability Zones?
_____ means built‑in component redundancy and _____ means resources dynamically adjust to demand.
True or False? Availability Zones within a Region are connected via low‑latency links.
AWS recommends provisioning compute resources across _____ Availability Zones.
True or False? Edge locations are only located in the same general area as Regions.
What is the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
In the shared responsibility model, which are examples of 'Security IN the cloud'?
options: Encrypt data at rest and in transit

questions.question: Which is AWS's responsibility under the shared responsibility model?
When creating an IAM user, what two types of access can be granted?
AWS Organizations enables you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts.
Best practices to secure your account with IAM? (Choose two)
Which task should be done by the AWS account root user?
After initial login, what is best practice for the root user?
How to add an extra login security layer to a user's AWS console?
AWS KMS enables you to assess, audit, and evaluate resource configurations.
Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS?
With Amazon VPC, what is the smallest size subnet you can have in a VPC?
With Amazon VPC, what is the maximum size IP address range you can have in a VPC?
You need to allow resources in a private subnet to access the internet. What must be present?
Private subnets have direct access to the internet.
Which component of AWS Global Infrastructure does CloudFront use to ensure low latency?
Which is an optional security control at the subnet layer of a VPC?
When you create a new VPC, what happens by default?
options: A main route table is created

questions.question: Which can be used to protect Amazon EC2 instances hosted in AWS?
You assign VPC CIDR 10.0.1.0/24 (256 addresses). How many IPs are available?
Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for varying workloads?
For monthly reports iterating through very large data amounts, which EC2 purchasing option to consider?
What is included in an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
Which EC2 feature ensures your instances will not share a physical host with other customers?
Which is a serverless compute service in AWS?
Which AWS service enables developers to easily deploy and manage applications?
Your app needs 4 instances steady; on last day traffic triples. Most cost‑effective approach?
options: Run 4 On‑Demand then +8 On‑Demand last day
Run 4 Reserved then +8 On‑Demand last day
Run 4 On‑Demand then +8 Reserved last day

questions.question: True or False? Containers contain an entire operating system.
Which EC2 option is best for long‑term workloads with predictable usage?
When launching a new EC2 Windows instance, which must be specified? (Choose two)
True or False? Amazon S3 is object storage suitable for flat files like docs and photos.
Amazon S3 replicates all objects _____.
options: On multiple volumes within an AZ
In multiple Availability Zones within the same Region

questions.question: Which can be used as a storage class for an S3 lifecycle policy? (Choose three)
The name of an S3 bucket must be unique ______.
You can use Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) to:
options: Provide elastic file storage only within AWS
Implement storage for EC2 instances that multiple VMs can access simultaneously

questions.question: Amazon EBS is recommended when data ______ and ______. (Choose two)
options: Must be quickly accessible, requiring long‑term persistence
Needs to be stored in a different AZ than the EC2 instance

questions.question: By default, all data stored in Amazon S3 is viewable by the public.
Regarding Amazon S3 Glacier, what is a Vault?
options: A policy identifying who can access Glacier content

questions.question: True or False? When you create a bucket in Amazon S3, it is associated with a specific AWS Region.
Which are features of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)? (Choose two)
options: Data on an EBS volume is lost when the attached instance is stopped
EBS volumes can be encrypted transparently
EBS data is automatically backed up to tape
Data on EBS is automatically replicated within an Availability Zone

questions.question: Which database is best to hold session state for hundreds of thousands of concurrent users?
You need to find an item in a DynamoDB table using a non‑key attribute. Which operation should you use?
In DynamoDB, what does the Query operation enable you to do?
options: Query a table using the partition key and optional sort key filter
Query any secondary indexes on a table
Efficiently retrieve items from a table or secondary index

questions.question: Which service is best for analyzing data using SQL and existing BI tools?
In DynamoDB, an attribute is ______.
Which use case is appropriate for Amazon RDS?
A .NET app with MySQL wants HA and automated backups on AWS. Which database fits best?
If you need extremely fast performance, fast scalability, and schema flexibility, which service?
True or False? Amazon RDS automatically patches DB software and performs backups for point‑in‑time recovery.
What should you consider when choosing database type?
Which is NOT one of the four areas of the Performance Efficiency pillar?
Which is a principle when designing cloud‑based systems?
options: Use as many services as possible

questions.question: Which are pillars of the AWS Well‑Architected Framework? (Choose three)
Recommended design principles for performance efficiency? (Choose two)
AWS Trusted Advisor provides insight in which five categories?
options: Performance, cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, service limits
Security, fault tolerance, high availability, connectivity, service limits
Performance, cost optimization, access control, connectivity, security
Security, access control, high availability, performance, service limits

questions.question: What is the focus of the Sustainability pillar?
options: Minimizing environmental impacts of running cloud workloads

questions.question: The AWS Well‑Architected Framework is organized into how many pillars?
Which online tool can assist in security compliance after moving to AWS?
Which is a measure of a system's ability to provide functionality when desired by the user?
What is the ability of a system to remain operational even if some components fail?
Which best describes a system that withstands some degradation, has minimal downtime, and needs minimal human intervention?
Which AWS tools help your application scale up/down based on demand? (Choose two)
Which service sends alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
Characteristics of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling? (Choose three)
options: Launches instances from a specified AMI
Enforces a minimum number of running instances

questions.question: What must be configured on an Elastic Load Balancer to accept incoming traffic?
Elements used to create an EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration? (Choose three)
Which service helps you collect important metrics from RDS and EC2 instances?
Which are elements of an Auto Scaling group? (Choose three)
A team needs a log of all access to AWS resources in the account. Which service provides this?
In Elastic Load Balancing, when an unhealthy target is detected, which are true? (Choose three)
options: Stops routing traffic to that target
Resumes routing when the target is healthy again
Resumes routing only when manually restarted
Routes traffic to a healthy target
